text:
Four hundred thousand years ago
They came from outer space and gave us life here
And we are just taking everything for granted
I don't think we should do this now
And when I see the smoke around
I feel like I'm not from humankind down there
I feel like glaciers are my eyes
And mountains are my head, my heart is ocean
And I feel all alone
'Cause everybody's wrong, I fear the living
What is this thing that we call hate?
And that's inside of me, get out of here

A world is down, and none can rebuild it
Disabled lands are evolving
My eyes are shut, a vision is dying
My head explodes, and I fall in disgrace

I hold my inner child within
And tell him not to cry: "Don't fear the living"
One day you will stand as a king
And no fear can erase this light below us
Each one of us is now engaged
This secret we all have, this truth is growing
And as a warrior, I have to fight
I can already feel the love I'll discover
I had this dream, our planet surviving

The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds, the fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open thy eyes and let all this flow in
Now see a new hope is growing inside

We will see our children growing

text: I don't know to describe this. But when the song starts playing, that riff. I don't know, it's like the conflict and peace inside me are both increasing and also getting calmed. I feel like my body is somehow breaking to the essence of myself. And in the end I can feel the pain, the primal pain and emotional pain in my brain and guts and in the end is like I find a bit of peace, but it's not complete. I'm writting this with tears in my eyes... The only and last thing I can say is that  even though that I will never meet them and the most probably thing is that they will never read this but I don't care bacause I'm feeling like I am cleaning my mind, all I can say is thank you Gojira, thank you for making such great music and for giving me strength when I felt alone and in my weak moments. Thank you.

text: ¬†@Regortex¬† That's true, but hey, that's the beauty of humanity, we're all different and of course there's people who disagree with them, they don't feel identified with their beliefs and statements, and that's ok, music is a form of expression and while expressing your thoughts and feeling people who share the same or similar thoughts with you will join you
author: gs518

text: YoBoss - personally I like to separate politics from leisure activities, sports, and especially art/music. I know I‚Äôm not alone, look at the NFL and their ratings, I wonder if they and other major league sports will ever recover. Rage Against the Machine is a band I can‚Äôt tolerate anymore because of their politics, they‚Äôve made themselves a divisive band that resorts to activism to prop up their lame music that can‚Äôt stand on its own artistic merits. Gojira is a great band that doesn‚Äôt need a gimmick or sjw stance to have their music be appreciated. It‚Äôs still a free country and it‚Äôs their decision and kudos the them for doing what they feel is right, it‚Äôs just too bad for people that don‚Äôt follow the same ideology.
author: Regortex

text: ¬†@Regortex¬† u know what? I got you and that what I dislike the most about the music scene in my city, it's mainly all about opression, disagreeing with the goverment and stuff like that, and it gets old ya know, gets a little boring, that's why I'm aiming to do something totally different with my band, but I personally have no problem talking about environment and earth itself since it is something more important imo than shitty politics
author: gs518

text: ¬†@Regortex¬† Also imo the global warming topic isn't necessarily political, I think it gets political only if you make ir political, but I think it goes beyond that, politics are way too far behind it
author: gs518

text: YoBoss - cool, I‚Äôd try to still to topics that aren‚Äôt divisive, you will have a broader appeal. The environmental movement is completely political to me as it‚Äôs been around for most of my life. Severin Cullis-Suzuki did a speech at the Earth Summit in1992 in Rio De Janeiro, she was 12 years old, the video is on YouTube. Greta Thunberg acts like she‚Äôs earths saviour at 16, her Schlick and speech is a direct copy of what Suzuki did 28 years ago. The predictions that have been made for at least 50 solid years now, have not come true, not one. The narrative has changed over and over again to suit the current political climate and draw funds from the government accordingly. It‚Äôs sick and disgusting, certain people, David Suzuki, Al Gore, just to name two, have made untold millions off of fear mongering. Of course the climate is changing, it would with or without humans, or course humans should do everything they can to not destroy the environment, it goes without saying, especially in a metal song. Haha.

text: If you‚Äôre talking about the verse, he is doing RLL  1/8  note triplets, hitting the snare with accents on the 2 and 4.
author: Scott Chantos

text: He‚Äôs just bouncing the stick - no gravity blast here (Mario doesn‚Äôt do the gravity blast and it‚Äôs really impractical to do a gravity blast in the context of RLL). If you want to play this just focus on your bounces as you‚Äôll need to get use to playing this pattern repeatedly with correct technique. I‚Äôm imagining that you come from a pretty heavy background and the first thing you assumed was a gravity blast hahaha. Keep in mind proper technique, finesse and control while practicing this. Hope this helped bud.
author: TakenBacon

text:
¬†@TakenBacon¬†   


Thx for the answer. I'm actually only beginner (crawling my way to intermediate) so I'm mostly curious about more advanced techniques. 
I gave gravity blast a spin to see what if felt like and I was thinking that it might reused outside of more heavy contexts in order to play more subtle things such as ghost notes and not just heavy blast. I stumbled upon this video where the guy shows how to use differently (towards 3:30) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ctR_mRCXVIg Looked interesting :)

Anyway thx for the pro tips, I'll keep practising to try to get the hang ot these sweet controlled rolls. It's not like there's much to do outside these days anyway :p

text: ¬†@Levi Carvalho¬† uhh yes?   thousands of villages are underwater, plus there are floods in countries where there have been none.   if you were to measure the thickness of the polar ices with  a rope over a year, you'd clearly see the ice having melted over a metre in thickness.  our country, which is rising from above the water still, is slowly starting to go back into  the water due to rising sea level.  plus, rising sea levels are not all there is to it. it includes the expansion of deserts, the cutting down of rainforests,  that store 30% of our oxygen and release a fuckton of cO2,  glaciers are melting. austrian glaciers are now completely out of any snow or ice, and it all has melted away in just about 30  years. tropical animals and insects are starting to settle further up north and us here up in the arctic circle are starting to get more tropical and extreme weathers on a annual basis. the annual life cycles of many small animals aswell as insects have fucked up here, as winter is no from november-december to april, no, now  it's rare we even have winter for a month. this year we've had no real winter at all, and it has made the swans to stay over for the entire year, which is harmful  for the ecosystem, since we need other birds aswell. author: Celatra

text:
¬†@Celatra¬† CO2 is not the cause btw the major greenhouse gas is water vapor so you might as well cry about the rain  :P
water vapor specific heat = 1.864 kJ/kg @300K
water vapor concentration in atmosphere = ~4%
co2 specific heat = 0.846 kJ/kg @300k
co2 concentration in atmosphere = ~0.04%
water vapor(1.864kJ/kg x 4%) / co2(0.846kJ/kg x0.04%) = 220.33...therefore water vapor traps over 220 times more heat than co2.
Now take your global warming fear mongering elsewhere chump!
author: nucleardubs

text:
¬†@nucleardubs¬†  if that were true, then earth should have in the past been much hotter due to faster vaporing water. Here's the thing- our magnetosphere is thicker now than before. Plus, we also get more water from the melting ice and therefore the loss/gain ratio for now is more or less 0. Therefore, You are wrong. Now. 

When polar ices melt, they no longer will be able to reflect heat back  into space, instead, the water absorbs all heat from the sun.

I want you to realize that...water vapors faster the hotter the earth gets. And guess whst? During the industrial revolution we released so much cO2 into the atmosphere that, earth globally increased 1 degree il temperature and also started vaporizing local waters away.

Aand. 
The concentration is 0.04, yes. But due to our thick atmosphere and other elements in it, it should be no more than 0.01. We used to have 97% in the past back when the sun was smaller and earth had a weaker magnetosphere & less oxygen. However, times have changed since.


Also i've never heard of such a dumb statement. For water vaporing to be the only cause you'd had to explain where all the sinking villages and melting glaciers come from.

Four hundred thousend years ago

text:
¬†@SC O'Dubhlaoch¬† global warming is real. the  polar ices have melted with over  30 square kilometres in just a few decades, the global water levels are rising and  every country has had its hottest year for 10 years straight. not just that, tropical animal and insect species are moving north,  and viruses that couldn't survive in the north pole and the arctic circle, now can procreate and spread there too.  Deserts are growing and  blowing dust over villages.  Record strong storms have been  recorded almost every year.  If that isn't enough to convince you,  We have had less and less snow every year for the last 2 decades. Every place in finland has had a decrease in snow with almost 10 inches in only 30 years.


now see here's the thing about science, it changes, unlike religion. YES, we are still in a mini ice age, but at the rate of which we have polluted during the industrial revolution, we have released so much C02 that the consequences are irreversible. And, while it's ALSO TRUE that the earth used to have 97% of it's atmosphere consisting of  C02 some 4 billion years ago, things have changed since then. The sun has become larger and hotter since and earth's magnetosphere has become stronger. We no longer cannot maintain life with that much CO2. Truth is, the damage has already been done and not much can be done about it. What I don't advocate is denying our contribution to it- graphs show consistently that only in the past 100 years has the earth gone up one full degree in global temperature- right around the time of the industrial revolution and into the modern age.
author: Celatra

author: Yroc 5000

text: ¬†@SC O'Dubhlaoch¬† If I had gotten a dollar for everytime I heard this idiotic strawman i'd be wealthy enough to fund 100% renewable energy worldwide. What you and others fail to understand is that not only would no climatologist worldwide object to the fact that earths climate has changed and will change from natural causes, the reason why you are able to state it so confidently is the very research of those climatologist that you desperately try to discredit. So the issue of our times is not that the climate changes itself, it's the rate of the change (which is alot higher and stronger than any natural causes are capable of) and the cause of the change (which is CO2 released by the usage of fossil fuels for energy and other human consumption). And this is what everyone around you is talking about. If you (or any chance reader) want to enter the genuine conversation at any point I suggest the site https://skepticalscience.com/ as a good starting point.

text:
¬†@Gustavo Mazonave¬† Im glad you enjoy the new Tool album, but I think its fair to say it is at least a Bit disappointing - I know it is to me. I listened to it a number of times when it came out, and it just felt like a rehash of their old material. As it happens, decided to give it another go a couple of days ago, and while I do think that some of the songs are decent and sound enjoyable, theyre still Tool by the numbers - and not to mention the songs which I Still think are pretty mediocre, to be generous.


With that said, I agree with your sentiment - music is not a competition, and everyone is a winner when they have something they like to listen to, so how about sharing that joy about something you like, rather than bitterness about what you dont. Sharing constructive critique, though, is something that Can be positive, if done correctly, so no qualms about that.

You have a superiority complex. You legit believe your taste is superiour than others. You're no one to determine whether something is good or not. This is why metalheads get laughed at, because people like you have to flex on how better metal is.

 Now, don't get me wrong, I love Gojira to death and they're definitely up there among the heaviest and best modern metal bands and musicians but there is legit no need to feel superior. Grow up dude and open up your mind, no need to go with a tunnel vision in life.

text:
I love both bands. I‚Äôd love a tour of the two together. I think FI by Tool is a phenomenal album. It all fits together like one entire song. Try doing Tool‚Äôs old vocals when you reach the age of 50. They‚Äôre artist and have grown. Not to mention I saw them twice when FI came out and they nailed each show, even at the one in AC the same day Maynard fucked his leg up. I think he said it was a Torn ACL. He didn‚Äôt move around much, but he didn‚Äôt miss a note. He also had covid 2x. Covid is no joke, especially on the lungs. I get that the guy doesn‚Äôt sing like he use to, but he‚Äôs in his mid 50‚Äôs that was hit pretty hard by a virus which can easily destroy the lungs. They also do what they want, make the music they want, and put it out when they want, much like Gojira. I‚Äôve read similar comments by Gojira fans when Magma came out, which is also a phenomenal album. People complained then how it didn‚Äôt sound like or was as heavy as, the Way of All Flesh. To each their own. Doesn‚Äôt mean any band should stay static and create music according to what others want. 

I‚Äôm grateful to have any of the music produced by either band. I feel lucky to be in the now and be inspired by their art individually and collectively. I‚Äôm also in love with Fortitude. Gojira has grown, so has Tool. I‚Äôve grown with them.

text: ≈Ωiga Auer People film arctic sea ice in mid summer when it is under 24hr sunlight.  They do not tell you ice regenerates in the 24darkness winter season. The ice isnt going anywhere. Polar bears in Canada are so high, native communities have spray painted problem bears. Earths temp has warmed 1.6c since 1880 according to NASA. And they wouldnt be building multi million dollar condos on the shoreline in Florida if it was about to sink. Think critically, they want your money.
author: Chuck Beef

text:
¬†@Chuck Beef¬† Why are you people so thick? Go look at sea ice extent in 1981 and sea ice extent today. This year will be the first year ever that sea ice extent during summer drops bellow 3 million sq km, compared to 6.3 million sq km in 1981

https://nsidc.org/arcticseaicenews/charctic-interactive-sea-ice-graph/

This isnt going to cause drastic sea rise, so your stupid condo argument is pointless. Sealevel rise is long term, projections are around 3-6 milimeters per year, for about a meter by 2100. So people are building condos because its not going to flood them in 10, 20, 40 or whatever years. 

The fucking problem is that it is getting so bad in 40 years that we will probably have an iceless arctic by 2050 during the summer. Arctic ice isnt problematic because it will rise sea levels - most of it is sea ice so it wont rise sea levels since it already is in water. The antarctic is dangerous for sea level rise because most ice there is continental.

The problem with loss of ice is that ice is signifcantly more reflective to sunlight than earth or water. Loss of ice means arctic summers will warm the ocean and the permafrost instead od melting and reflecting off of ice. This will not only cause havoc to local wildlife and human populations, it will cause dramatic weather changes due to changing water currents, it will probably end up releasing gigatons od trapped methane from the seabeds and the permafrost, which is a potent greenhouse gas causing an even more drastic effect on the climate.

The earth wont die for sure, but our societies will collapse when areas that were historically humid will become dry, coastal areas will become swamps, glacial rivers will dry up, and plantlife will die and change to adapt to the changing temperatures. 

1.6 degrees warming in 140 years is catastrophic, especially when its accelerating for the past 40 years at about 0.15-0.2 degrees per decade (according to NASA). It took earth 5000 years to warm 5 degrees from the last ice age, we will warm the earth by 5 degrees in a little over 100 years at this pace.

But sure, some dingus is building condos in Florida, disproving all of this. I guess Hitler and WWII also didnt happen and were a tax fraud because Hans built himself a nice mansion in Dresden in 1945, right before it got supposedly ""bombed"".

Think critically? They want your money? Think critically for second and ask yourself who do you think wants your money - NASA, all the universities on the planet, meteorological agencies? Or the established industrial sector, oil industry, shipping industry etc., whose prime interested is keeping this as is and protecting their profits? The guy building and selling those condos also has a vested interest in denying climate change since it means people will not be afraid of buying the condos that might get flooded in the next century.

Lyrics:
Four hundred thousand years ago
They came from outer space

I feel like I'm now

And mountains are my head

What is this thing that we call hate

A world is down

Disabled lands are evolving

My head explodes
And I fall in disgrace

I hold my inner child within
And tell him not to cry
"don't fear the living"
One day you will stand as a king
And now fear can erase
This light below us
Each one of us is now engaged
This secret we all have
This truth is growing
And as a warrior I have to fight
I can already feel
The love I'll discover

I had this dream, our planet surviving
The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds
The fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open your eyes and let all this flow
Now see a now hope is growing inside

We will see our children growing


Enjoy :)

text: 400 000 years ago? Someone please explain.
author: Wayde

text:
¬†@Wayde¬† You unedited comment was "4000 years? Someone please explain. Are they Christians, or maybe scientologists?"

To answer the question, as far as I know it's neither. I highly doubt they're scientologists,  because it would've been shoved down our throats to join over & over again by now.

As for being Christians? There are christians that don't go along with the normal Bible's creation story. Instead you have the Big Bang happening 13.8 billion years ago, the Earth was created 4.5 billion years ago. But the one who created the universe & everything in it was 'God'.

As for the significance of 400,000 years, that would be that it is theorised that the Homo sapiens species (Us) diversified from our evolutionary ancestors & became our own species around this time.

There's a lot of talk about "the missing link" between the ancient proto-humans & what eventually became us. We haven't found the remains of what links our theorised ancestral species & the species that eventually became us.

This is something that deniers of the Theory of Evolution like the latch on to & insert conspiracy theories, religious explanations, or like in this example, suggest that there may have been outside interference by an intelligent species.
author: TheLonelyBrit

text: ¬†@TheLonelyBrit¬† I think the 400.000 years references panspermia, basically that life came frome somewhere else in the universe and landet on earth some time ago. 400.000 years is more of a placeholder.
author: Nbdwhy ,

text: ¬†@Nbdwhy ,¬† to me it feels more like that the ''coming from outer space 400 000 ago'' means that the human species differ a lot from the other (like they would be from another world (even though they're not)), because the panspermia, that you mentioned, is usually said to brought life to Earth like 3,7 billion years ago (first life on Earth). A lot of people don't think that life could develop so fast (cca 1 billion years) from non-living matter.
author: Jakub Janda

text:
¬†@Nbdwhy ,¬† The Panspermia Theory is that the reason life exists on Earth is that in the planet's early formation, maybe a bit later by ~1 billion years (not 400,000 years ago, that's way too soon), there were impacts from asteroids that contained either the building blocks of life, proto-RNA/DNA organisms, or just straight up early organisms with RNA/DNA bacteria as we know them today.

I'm not about to say that Earth is the only place where life has come into being anywhere in the universe. I truly believe that there is life outside of our solar system (maybe even in it on some of the moons eg Enceladus). With how utterly & terrifyingly vast a single galaxy is, and there are a lot of galaxies, Earth being the only source of life is preposterous.

The problem I find with the Pansermia Theory is that it doesn't explain where that asteroid/whatever came from, or where whatever it was carrying came from.
author: TheLonelyBrit

text:
Four hundred thousand years ago
They came from outer space
And gave us life here
And we are taking everything for granted
I don't think we should do this now
And when I see the smoke around
I feel like I'm not
From humankind down there
I feel like glaciers are my eyes
And mountains are my head
My heart is ocean
And I feel all alone
Because everybody's wrong
I feel the living
What is this thing that we call hate
And that's inside of me
Get out of here!

A world is down
And none can rebuild it
Disabled lands are evolving
My eyes are shut, a vision is dying
My head explodes
And I fall in disgrace

I hold my inner child within
And tell him not to cry
"don't fear the living"
One day you will stand as a king
And no fear can erase
This light below us
Each one of us is now engaged
This secret we all have
This truth is growing
And as a warrior I have to fight
I can already feel
The love I'll discover

I had this dream, our planet surviving
The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds
The fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open your eyes and let all this flow
Now see a new hope is growing inside

We will see our children growing

text:
S'il vous plait les gars, jouez ce morceau sur sc√®ne. Il est l'√¢me de Gojira comme tout cet album d'ailleurs. J'ai retrouv√© ces sensations sur le titre Magma, shooting star ou encore low lands sur le dernier. Je vous ai vu une dizaine de fois en concert depuis vos d√©buts, mais √† Gu√©thary, quand vous aviez jou√© pour la sortie de from mars to sirius, c'√©tait magique, chez nous, en el pais basco. Vous √©tiez dans le public √† discuter comme √† la maison apr√®s le live. D'ailleurs, j'√©tais un peu d√©√ßu que global warming ne soit pas interpret√© mais bon... C'√©tait quand m√™me g√©nial! Vous savez le jouer en live, faites le! Putain c'est un ORDRE!!! Thierry
Please guys, play this track on stage. That's the Gojira's soul as all this album by the way. I've found these feelings on the magma track and shooting star, also low lands on the last opus I've seen you guys maybe 10 times on stage from your beginning, but Guethary, when you played for From mars to sirius, that was magical, at home, en el pais basco. You were with the crowd, discussing like in your own home after the show. By the way, I was pretty disappointed you didn't play Global warming... But that was awesome! You know how to play it live, so do it! That's a fuckin' ORDER!!!

text:
So many years have passed since i heard this masterpiece for the first time and ive always hoped to hear it live one day.
Every years at every Gojira shows i went, i always hoped this was finally the day i could witness that.
Now i understand why they couldn't do it‚Ä¶ its so emotionally heavy, challenging and complex.
Im so grateful to finally witness it, even if it is via YouTube, it just reached my soul in a way words cannot describe.
author: Vincent Pratte

text:
There are times where I find things inside me I need to release.  This song does it for me.  It relinquishes some of the weight of the human experience by proclaiming certain things I see that bother me.  I don't think I could recite these lyrics to the powerful extent Joe does without tears streaming down my face.  They've always had an incredible sense of compassion, honesty, and love aimed towards the human condition.  


Thank you guys for keeping my spirit alive and well. Much love to all of you
author: Nick G

text:
Four hundred thousand years ago
They came from outer space and gave us life here
And we are just taking everything for granted
I don't think we should do this now
And when I see the smoke around
I feel like I'm not from humankind down there
I feel like glaciers are my eyes
And mountains are my head, my heart is ocean
And I feel all alone
'Cause everybody's wrong, I fear the living
What is this thing that we call hate?
And that's inside of me, get out of here

[Chorus]
A world is down, and none can rebuild it
Disabled lands are evolving
My eyes are shut, a vision is dying
My head explodes, and I fall in disgrace

I hold my inner child within
And tell him not to cry: "Don't fear the living"
One day you will stand as a king
And no fear can erase this light below us
Each one of us is now engaged
This secret we all have, this truth is growing
And as a warrior, I have to fight
I can already feel the love I'll discover

I had this dream, our planet surviving
The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds, the fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open thy eyes and let all this flow in
Now see a new hope is growing inside

We will see our children growing

text:
Back then I wasn't a metalhead. I could enjoy some tracks of Heavy and Power which was already surprising since I didn't like metal when I was younger.
Then a friend invited me for a concert. Gojira was playing in Belgium, at l'Ancienne Belgique.
When Joe entered the scene, I was already feeling something. I felt his aura. I felt his power.
Then they started playing "Only Pain". I swear. I was blown away.
I've never had such a great concert.
They made me love metal. They made me love their music.
I've never had a band or a musician I could listen everyday without getting bored after two weeks. 
Gojira is the only band I could listen all day long, everyday.

Merci Gojira.
Merci √©normement.

author: Frederick Dumoulin

text:
‚Äã¬†@Abscessedcadaver¬† ‚Äã Dude don't be that generic metal elitist that judges songs by how many riffs they have or their longevity. There's more to music than having lots of riffs, everything flows along smoothly, the way they hit the notes on the guitar, the feeling and soundscape they transmit, his voice, it's very challenging to sound like them. Especially live, they are absolutely phenomenal. Personally listening to this gives me shivers down my spine. They have every detail down, they are extremely technical, and your favourite bands love their ass too.
I love Death, Cynic and Gojira. It's easy to to say someone is worse than fucking Sean Reinert, one of the most influential drummers of all time, which is actually one of his idols.
This is not supposed to sound like Death, Mario has his own style which is instantly recognizable, he sounds like a well synchronized machine but still has so much groove.
Try to learn one of their songs and sound EXACTLY like him. I guarantee that you will have a tough time.
BTW I used to think like you, but the I realized the criteria I used to determine what was good music for me was just as valid as the criteria other people used. It's just taste. Chill. The music isn't just what the guitar is playing, it's the whole thing, the chords, the modes, the notes that are off, the silences, the rhythm changes.

text:
¬†@Abscessedcadaver¬† Lmao, you're supposed to hear ghost notes. Do you even play? Be honest kid. Gojira out of ALL the bands you just listed aren't even THAT popular. All you did was name off some big names in their respective genre and then tossed Gojira in there. Weak trolling, bud. I get it though. You're probably fifteen and just had your balls drop so you think you're tough shit. Mommy and Daddy, and even some of your friends can't tread on you now so why take shit from YouTube?The music you like is amazing, but bands that other people enjoy "are like totally overrated". 

.Don't worry little metal head you'll grow out of that phase. I hate Slipgay and Fagtillica as much as the next guy I just don't think I'm special for it ;P. Easiest way to spot a budding metal head who is enjoying the heavier side of the music is their listing of Death like they're the best band to ever hit the scene. If you're going to act like an elitist that only listens to underground shit don't name off probably the most influential Death Metal band. I was that kid too. Shit on anything that I could physically play myself while admiring bands for their technical aspects. Then I grew up, expanded my mind, let in other opinions, and I grew as a drummer, and a person. Chill.

Four hundred thousend years ago
They came from outer space
And gave us life here
We are taking everything for granted
I don't think we should do this now

I feel like I'm now
From humankind down there
I feel like glaciers are my eyes
And mountains are my head
My heart is ocean
And I feel all alone
Because everybody's wrong
I feel the living
What is this thing that we call hate
And that's inside of me
Get out of here!

A world is down
And none can rebuild it
Disabled lands are evolving

My head explodes
And I fall in disgrace

I hold my inner child within
And tell him not to cry

One day you will stand as a king
And now fear can erase
This light below us

This truth is growing

I can already feel
The love I'll discover

I had this dream, our planet surviving
The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds
The fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open your eyes and let all this flow
Now see a now hope is growing inside

We will see our children growing

text:
¬†@unamed watcher¬† Yes, the tapping is a huge reason why I personally think this song blows. IN MY OPINION tapping is a gimmicky technique that is EASILY misused. Listen to Van Halen for the best use of tapping ever - compared to this song where every verse is composed of two guitars playing the same tapping part, and it's a boring and unimaginative part at that.

Just gross imo
author: samsar0125

text: ¬†@samsar0125¬† how is this unimaginative, do you have to invent a new technique every time you make a song. Van Halen and most 80s bands used tapping for solos, I cant think of many songs with tapping for a main riff. Tapping is a tool that you can use to create a song, you complaining about it is like complaining about an artist using a certain type of brush.
author: unamed watcher

text: Also you are comparing a band that revolutionized a genre to just a really cool band, dont set your standards as high as Van Halen or you won't be able to find bands you like.
author: unamed watcher

text: ¬†@unamed watcher¬† I like plenty of bands, I also like The Heaviest Matter of the Universe. This song, however, is an ear sore IMO. I've seen them live, which was pretty cool. I just don't understand the hype. To each his own, I wish you a good day day.

Anyway like it or not its beyond you.

text: ¬†@ProjectMaelstrom¬† You sound very butt hurt mate. I said all along that it's my personal opinion that I think this track blows gonads. Killer drum beat though, in my humble opinion that is of course.

text: ¬†@samsar0125¬† Gojira's music just gives me an extreme sense of (will)power and purpose the likes of which no other band has ever made me feel. I love the death metal vocals, which consist of the best combination of melody, emotion and heaviness I've ever heard. I love the lyrical content and how thematically different it is from that of most extreme metal bands. All of this makes Gojira my favorite band. I don't know how it is for other people, but I can imagine why Gojira has become so popular. I even think Gojira is highly underrated, but that's just my opinion.

text:
¬†@N¬† Just to be clear, I do like some of Gojira's stuff (Heaviest matter, stranded, whales).
Taste will always be subjective, but I'm pretty sure I mentioned Van Halen's "Hot For Teacher" earlier in this thread. To me, that intro riff is tapping at its finest: cheesy, 80's shredding. I like it as a lead technique, not for rhythm/riffs.
Eddie is one of the GOATs imo so I'm a little biased.

text:
Four hundred thousend years ago
They came from outer space
And gave us life here
We are taking everything for granted
I don't think we should do this now
And when I see the smoke all around
I feel like I'm now
From humankind down there
I feel like glaciers are my eyes
And mountains are my head
My heart is ocean
And I feel all alone
Because everybody's wrong
I feel the living
What is this thing that we call hate
And that's inside of me
Get out of here!
A world is down
And none can rebuild it
Disabled lands are evolving
My eyes are shut, a vision is dying
My head explodes
And I fall in disgrace
I hold my inner child within
And tell him not to cry
"don't fear the living"
One day you will stand as a king
And now fear can erase
This light below us
Each one of us is now engaged
This secret we all have
This truth is growing
And as a warrior I have to fight
I can already feel
The love I'll discover
I had this dream, our planet surviving
The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds
The fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open your eyes and let all this flow
Now see a now hope is growing inside
We will see our children growing

We're love you guys! <3

text:
GLOBAL WARMING

Four hundred thousand years ago¬†
They came from outer space¬†
And gave us life here¬†
And we are taking everything for granted¬†
I don't think we should do this now¬†
And when I see the smoke around¬†
I feel like I'm not¬†
From humankind down there¬†
I feel like glaciers are my eyes¬†
And mountains are my head¬†
My heart is ocean¬†
And I feel all alone¬†
Because everybody's wrong¬†
I feel the living¬†
What is this thing that we call hate¬†
And that's inside of me¬†
Get out of here!¬†

A world is down¬†
And none can rebuild it¬†
Disabled lands are evolving¬†
My eyes are shut, a vision is dying¬†
My head explodes¬†
And I fall in disgrace

I hold my inner child within¬†
And tell him not to cry¬†
"don't fear the living"¬†
One day you will stand as a king¬†
And now fear can erase¬†
This light below us¬†
Each one of us is now engaged¬†
This secret we all have¬†
This truth is growing¬†
And as a warrior I have to fight¬†
I can already feel¬†
The love I'll discover¬†

I had this dream, our planet surviving¬†
The guiding stars always growing¬†
And all the worlds¬†
The fates all the countries¬†
They're all rebuilding at the same time¬†
I never fell and always believed in¬†
We could evolve and get older¬†
Open your eyes and let all this flow¬†
Now see a new hope is growing inside¬†

We will see our children grow

text: I don't think I could ever tire from listening to these amazing people.  This song holds a special place in my heart and to see it performed in such a raw setting with all the emotion that is clearly flowing over through all these amazing artists almost brings a tear to my eye.  Seeing these men in person was one of the most amazing parts of my life when it comes to my personal relationship with music and seeing them again after that was almost like the feeling you would get from coming home after an extended trip.  Gojira you are amazing and please understand that there are many people you have touched with your art.  Keep on rockin.  Love ya!

text: these guys always nail capturing the feeling and emotion of there lyrics and interpreting that in such a musically profound way, the fact that none of them are in sync except for during the main chorus.is realy cool. what the guitarist are doing is real amazing that they keep it together so cleanly as they are ever so slightly apart where they are landing there last note in the pattern they each are playing and it is creating that very interesting syncopated rhythm and all while the bass player is keeping a solid bass line and the drummer..where do we start with that guy.he just brings it all in on every track these guys have ever done together.the diversity in the flavors of his drumming and his energy are what make this band so dam good..like they say your only as good as your drummer,because he is the man...joe has for sure found his comfort zone and vocal range and just keeps getting better,,think it is cool that they revisited this one.always a challenge to go back and play older songs from many years ago....much respect..awesome track

text:
Music has to bring to life something in you that otherwise you wouldn't feel. But if it's only accompanied by bad words and empty messages, it diminishes its value. I know good music without substance and I also know bands/musicians that send the right messages. But Godjira is the only one I found to put the most important messages in the most wonderful lyrics, all coated by music that makes you turn inside out.
I hope everyone that listens to it will go further into searching real ways to ~change themselves to change the world~
Godjira must be understood, not only listened!

text:
Today, after seeing this video, I wiped out my carbon footprint. As an expat scientist, I fly a lot for work (but also for leisure), and I always felt really guilty to have such a massive CO2 footprint. I calculated how much I emitted by traveling & electricity grid consumption during the last 3.5 years using the calculator on ClimateCare.org; my footprint amounted to a total of ‚Ç¨166, which I donated to ClimateCare's projects on local clean and affordable energy in developing countries, thus both erasing my own footprint and helping others who are hit the hardest by climate change. It was a lot cheaper and easier than I expected. I hope it will help. Thank you Gojira, for finally giving me the final push to take action. 

For anyone who's interested: check out the calculator at https://climatecare.org/calculator/ and the projects they're investing in at https://climatecare.org/projects/

text: This song starts my morning playlist and is peppered in throughout the day. I work on hot blacktop all day and this song really puts into perspective all the shit I see throughout the day. Cars spewing exhaust and smokestacks wrecking the horizon. I used to be one of "them" and now gojira has taught me to be vigilant against the soulless planet wasters. Thank you gojira for helping me wake up and see, that without love for planet and love for one another, mankind is doomed, and on a very short path. We all need to come together for our children's sake and our grand children's sake. I would hate for our generation to be the last to enjoy a beautiful mother earth. Promote peace everybody and I love you GOJIRA!!

text: Integrity Gamer gojira is without a doubt one of the most important, original and great metal bands in the last two decades.  And they're great musicians and composers in music in general.  If you don't like it that's ok.  But them being great artists is not a matter of opinion.  I love a lot of different music genres other than metal and I'm a musician myself.  There are many bands that could be considered the best at what they do (here metal) and Gojira is definitely a valid choice.  Whether you like it or not.   Considering this song a "drivel" is just non sense.   A song speaking about a very important world issue while giving a positive message through very deep lyrics?   Yeah sure that's "teenage"  oh them being french make them arrogant?  Wtf... joe and mario are half american and live there now.  They have a huge love for english language, joe even said that he could not write the songs in another language because he thinks artistically in english.  They're very humble in real life and gojira is the band which allowed french metal to be known in the international.  It's because of them that festivals like hellfest are possible and they never took credit for it.  Their grammy was completely deserved and megadeth was chosen instead. I love megadeth but they're aging now and have nothing to prove while gojira clearly deserved that award and they were joking about it how are they arrogant?    Your entire comment and its arguments are just dumb and ignorant.

And all the three bands are led by duo of two brothers, guitar and drums. I feel like this is some weird way to be one of the best. text: My hat's off to the bassist. text: FanaticalDrummer no.  The tapping in this song is really hard and doing it for almost 8 minutes without making a single mistake is amazing.  And let's not forget that Joe's screaming vocals are absolutely not naturals.  It's a very hard and hatsh technique that requires a lot of practice.  It's brutal while still being melodic.  A mix between singing and screaming in a single tone.  And he's doing both playing and singing without making a single mistake.   So you might not like this song very much but to say something like it's weak or one of their weakest, and then say you don't play guitar and that you can do the same thing when you first picked up one....come on it's just stupid
author: Massive Cunt

text: Vince metallix Repeating something for 8 min does not make it good. It makes it a exercise. It super annoying and repetitive, and not exactly a good tapping variety. This is literally the pattern new guitarists write when tapping,  but its taking two to play it. The mood and feeling they were going for is ruined by the monotonous dynamics of this song. Its just weak and the guitars make it super annoying.

Global warming/climate change was just a way for governments to force taxes and suck more money from the masses because you can't win a war on what the earth decides to do. It will warm, it will cool, we can't stop it. But we can stop governments and corps from ruining rivers, and oceans, and lands with pollution.
author: Tracy Street

text:
pollution is a very broad term that includes things like co2 emissions, ozone depleters, and other greenhouse gasses
pollution also includes waste that you dumb into rivers, and trash you throw out your car window, and even cigarette smoke; you cannot say that pollution does not contribute to global warming, because it's too broad of a term not to
author: Link Freeman

text:
CrAzYCaM 8 CO2 amplifies IR absorption and pollution of sulphuric compounds, which can act as Cloud Condensation Nuclei, can influence the emissivity of earth, increasing the amount of energy absorbed by earth (black body radiation if you are interested).

One should note that the climate was far more unstable before than today (meaning also fsr more violent storms). Earth has succesively over time become more stable in many regards (amplitude of fluctuation was becoming smaller), until now. Right now we are influencing this stability which will likely have consequences. On the grand scale, life will go on, but things may prove very tough for much of humanity as droughts and flooding increase in frequency. Sea levels will continue to rise as they are doing now. Not because of ice melting (that has a contribution but small) but rather due to heat expansion of the water itself. Density of water decreases with increased temeprature which means that the volume of the water will change. It's a slow process due to how much water has been heated but it will inevitably happen, especially if we don't do anything about it.

author: Rough-Sawn Skateboards

text:
Grampas Mandolin Ah yes, my mistake, I thought when he said real scientists that he meant scientists who are well published within the field related to the scientific question at hand. Scientists that actually provide research that is contrary to the findings of contemporary papers. Instead we get a list of scientists from a variety of fields and we are to assume that simply because they are scientists alone their opinion should go beyond any scrutiny, a classic appeal to authority. I have in fact read the "Peer reviewed research" that they present on their website and I would honestly expect more from a university undergraduate. No research methodology, no discussion, poor sourcing (they produce claims that the source never made).

I guess what I had meant to ask, name 5 scientists who publish relevant papers? The scientists themselves are completely irrelevant, it's the research they have performed that is interesting.
author: Sebastian Jovancic

text: The climate change deniers need to look up the Milankovitch Cycles; furthermore, the RATE of temperature increase is what we are concerned about. Sure, temperatures have been higher before, but the Earth goes through three major cycles over thousands of years: eccentricity, obliquity, and precession -----> the changes in glaciation/temperatures are nearly all affected by these cycles. The current rise in temperatures, however, cannot be attributed to these cycles. Plus, decreasing pollution and switching to a green energy system would decrease the number of premature deaths caused by the toxic substances produced from the combustion of fossil fuels (i.e. PM2.5 and precursors to ground-level ozone).

text:
Four hundred thousand years ago
They came from outer space
And gave us life here
We are taking everything for granted
I don't think we should do this now

I feel like I'm now
From humankind down there

And mountains are my head
My heart is ocean
And I feel all alone
Because everybody's wrong

What is this thing that we call hate
And that's inside of me
Get out of here!

A world is down

Disabled lands are evolving

My head explodes

One day you will stand as a king

This light below us

This secret we all have
This truth is growing
And as a warrior I have to fight
I can already feel
The love I'll discover

I had this dream, our planet surviving
The guiding stars always growing
And all the worlds
The fates all the countries
They're all rebuilding at the same time
I never fell and always believed in
We could evolve and get older
Open your eyes and let all this flow
Now see a now hope is growing inside

We will see our children growing

text: Lightbringer Low tunings don't equal heavy. Gojira is more heavy than most metal bands that use lower tunings or any tunings regardless. "Heavy" can refer to the emotional weight, and Gojira doesn't just give you brutal riffs, drumming, and vocals. Their lyrics are always beautiful or thought provoking and sung with so much grit and emotion. That combined with the music is enough to shake anybody to their core if they're willing and open minded unlike a lot of people. You don't feel that sort of passion from most other bands. Every riff feels like it's played with so much passion, and same with Mario's drumming.

text: Well, Don't know about "best" or "most innovative". It's pretty relative. But definitely the most groovy, there's a level of technical skill here that would make jazz musicians cry. But there's also bands like Moonsorrow or Finntroll etc. who have their own technical things and masterful compositions. The best part about metal is that there's no one or two artists that would stand a head taller than the others, but rather there's a massive sea of people divided into their own little subgroups that all take the music into different directions.

text:
yea i have to agree with this guy, the where dragons dwell scream where he ferociously screams no used to be my single favorite vocal line for him; with the outro to oroborus garorock 2009 being a close second, the part from like 1:40-2:04 takes the cake for me now
it doesn't seem as sharp or refined, but that's what i like about it. it sounds super raw and has a ton of texture behind it, which to me equates to a more powerful line
just listen to that "GET OUT OF HERE"... incredible
and this is without a crowd backing him up, in the dragons vid you could tell he was getting pumped up by the crowd because he was putting more energy into it the further the song went, until they made their own wall of death, without being told to, and joe started getting into it a lot more; i'm really excited to see this played live if they decide to

author: Damien Delvall√©e

text: Damien Delvall√©e can you please explain to me how that is an argument or something to make the discussion advance?   Because I don't remember saying that it wasn't their work.   I was just making a point and pointing the fact that joe seemed tired and was struggling with his screams.  So wtf are you on about with that kind of "argument"?   You're probably the kind of person who says "huh they do what they want" about anything.   Omg...  Did I appropriate their work for myself or something?  Fuck...
author: Massive Cunt

text: I'm exactly the kind of person who says "huh, they do what they want" because that's what they'll do anyway.
author: Damien Delvall√©e

text: Damien Delvall√©e And nobody said the contrary so again your argument does not make any sense and is therefore completely irrelevant.
author: Massive Cunt

text: Well, that's your opinion... Mine was: stop whining about great bands evolving.
author: Damien Delvall√©e

text: Also: chill out, this is Internet. No one's right, and you don't get a token for "winning" an argument.
author: Damien Delvall√©e

text: Damien Delvall√©e that's what still don't seem to understand.  I'm not trying to win anything.  I was just making a point and pointing the fact that joe is nowaday struggling with his growls and screams.  It's not whining, it's called pointing a fact, and making an observation.  Did I say anything like "huh gojira has become casual" or something dumb like that? I don't think so.     My original point and opinion is that if Joe can't scream like he used to, they might make an album with too much clean vocals, and it could have a negative effect on magma because that was one of the reason why this album was so unique, even in the continuous legacy of masterpieces that they released before.   Because his clean vocals are very good but clearly not as unique as his screaming voice. And if I'm right, IF,  releasing a new album with completely clean vocals is more of a sad consequence than a real artistic choice. Because Joe clearly said he still loves to growl and scream as usual but he also wants to explore new horizons and mix it with   the rest.  And I'M MORE THAN HAPPY with that.    It's a huge part of Gojira's identity.  I stated in my first comment that I (so me as an individual) think it would be bad for the band.   So you understand that someone coming here to say "it's their work not yours. Stop whining they do what they want." is upsetting.   Because it's completely out of place and you reduce me as a stupid elitist, which I'm not.

And in the last years, that he got the clean vocals improved, he's just a boss at everything he does...

author: Ryan Kearney

text: His growl has changed because he lost a ton of power in his voice, and that is not a good thing. This performance sounds super strong compared to what Joe has been sounding like lately in live shows, and even then, it isn't nearly as close as showing that extremely impressive raw power his voice had in shows like Garorock and Vieilles Charrues. It's only natural though, since these genres always take a big toll on vocalist voices, it's just a shame when you can clearly see vocalists struggling on songs they once easily performed.
author: alek98

text: Indeed, you can clearly hear the voice struggling with the raw parts, surely now without particular editing or effects on the voice. But it's natural thing to occure in such bands over time. Especially those that actually didn't get any particular voice training (which is most of metal bands). I think we can expect more cleans from now on.

text: I don't think I could ever tire from listening to these amazing people.  This song holds a special place in my heart and to see it performed in such a raw setting with all the emotion that is clearly flowing over through all these amazing artists almost brings a tear to my eye.  Seeing these men in person was one of the most amazing parts of my life when it comes to my personal relationship with music and seeing them again after that was almost like the feeling you would get from coming home after an extended trip.  Gojira you are amazing and please understand that there are many people you have touched with your art.  Keep on rockin.  Love ya!

text: He's  not really a master of clean singing per se, but he has managed to create his own unique style of vocals. He growls out his words but at the same time he manages to let his real singing voice come through as well and that way his growls sound in pitch and almost melodic instead of just brutal (which they still do). He's always done this to a certain extent but the passion and power he puts behind it really shines in this recording.

text: triggers don't make a drummer faster, common misconception. All triggers do is clean up the sound, makes each note more distinct rather than blurring together. Even with no triggers whatsoever, Kolias from Nile, Harclerode from Whitechapel (formerly), McGraw form Cattle Decap, etc, are still kicking their bass drums exactly as fast as a triggered bass drum.
